admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
subsc: Non-compulsory pensions and insurance,Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Pension Reform
            Project is to assist China reform its pension system,
            through sustainable funding strategies. Also, the project
            aims at improving the pension system in a pilot province and
            city, so as to obtain experience and develop templates for
            the establishment of a national unified pension system. To
            this end, an actuarial model will be developed, to assess
            the financial viability of the Qingdao municipal, and, the
            Heilongjiang provincial pension systems, in accordance with
            existing parameters. The project components will include: 1)
            policy development, and, regulation drafting regarding
            pension reform issues; 2) development of sustainable funding
            strategies for the municipal and provincial pilot pension
            systems; 3) update and revision of information, and related
            administrative systems, both at the Ministry of Labor and
            Social Security (MOLSS), and the municipal and provincial
            pilots' labor bureaus, through the installation of
            automated systems for greater capacity and processing
            efficiency; 4) training, to support the enhancement of
            personnel skills requirements, which will include areas such
            as, pension management and reform policy, financial
            projections, and, pension asset management; 5) assistance in
            project administration at the level of MOLSS and pilot
            project units, supporting costs, such as, personnel,
            internal travel expenses, printing, communications,
            translation, and related expenses.
